name: Kali phosphoricum
Relationship: Compare: KALI HYPO PHOSPH. (DEBILITY WITH WASTING OF MUSCULAR TISSUE. Phosphaturia with general anemia or leucocythemia. Effects of excessive tea drinking. Chronic bronchitis where the expectoration is THICK AND FETID, sometimes SCANTY AND TOUGH. Dose - 5 grains of crude to 3X.) GENISTA - Dyer's Weed - (contains scopolamin; frontal headache and vertigo, worse motion, better open air and eating. Dry throat, awakes with water brash. Itching eruption on elbows, knees, and ankles. Promotes diuresis in dropsical conditions.) MACROZAMIA SPIRALIS. (Extreme debility after severe illness; collapse. Weariness from no assignable cause, no pains. Boring pain at vertex; vomiting and retching all night; impossible to eyes, giddiness and cold.) ZINC.; GELS.; CIMICIF.; LACHES.; MUR-AC.

Head: Occipital headache; better, after rising
Headaches are relieved by gentle motion
Vertigo, from lying, on standing up, from sitting, and when looking upward
Cerebral anaemia
Headache, with weary, empty, gone feeling at stomach
Stomach: A nervous gone sensation at the pit of the stomach
Abdomen: Cholera; stools have the appearance of rice water
Dysentery; stools consist of pure blood; patient becomes delirious; abdomen swells
Diarrhoea; foul, putrid odor; occasioned by fright, with depression and exhaustion
Mouth: Toothache, with easily-bleeding gums; they have a bright-red seam on them
Eyes: Weakness of sight; loss of perceptive power; after diphtheria; from exhaustion
Face: Right-sided neuralgia, relieved by cold applications
Livid and sunken, with hollow eyes
Nose: Nasal disease, with offensive odor; fetid discharge
Male: Nocturnal emissions; sexual power diminished; utter prostration after coitus
Ears: Humming and buzzing in the ears
Mind: Slightest labor seems a heavy task
Female: Menstruation too late or too scanty in pale, irritable, sensitive, lachrymose females
Too profuse discharge, deep-red or blackish-red, thin and not coagulating; some times with offensive odor
Extremities: Pains, with depression, and subsequent exhaustion
Paralytic lameness in back and extremities

details: One of the greatest nerve remedies. PROSTRATION. Weak and tired. Especially adapted to the young. Marked disturbance of the sympathetic nervous system. Conditions arising from WANT OF NERVE POWER, neurasthenia, mental and physical depression, are wonderfully improved by this remedy. The causes are usually excitement, overwork and worry. Besides, IT CORRESPONDS TO STATES OF ADYNAMIA AND DECAY, gangrenous conditions. In these two directions it has won many clinical laurels. Remember it in the treatment of suspected malignant tumors. After removal of cancer when in healing process skin is drawn TIGHT over the wound. Delayed labor.
dosage: Third to twelfth trituration. The highest potencies seem to be indicated in certain cases.
